Action.author: kchristidis
Action.body: ~mastersingh24 : Do you see us cutting a patch version before 1.2? (See FAB-10167 for the 1.2 item.)

Action.author: mastersingh24
Action.body: Generally speaking, we try not to version of core components for fix pack releases. One can argue that moving from Node 8.9.4 to 8.11.2 is not a big deal, but it can mean that people running NodeJS chaincode with 1.1 might be using different versions of Node for different chaincodes (because the chaincode was originally deployed with 1.1.0)

Action.author: mastersingh24
Action.body: ~davidkel Is this marked high just to bump up determining what we should do? Else this does seem high (or actually a bug)

Action.author: kchristidis
Action.body: OK, closing this and moving on with FAB-10167 then. Thanks Gari.
